answers.answer: Hi Hun!It can be. I have high blood pressure (as well as heart disease) and, quite often, I develop "edema" which is swelling of the ankles. There are, of course, other reasons for swelling, but that is my experience.It is certainly nothing to be ignored. If it continues, I would see the doctor.Big Hugs..IBK
thanks hun,  do you know if the swelling is from your blood pressure or from your heart disease?
From what I have heard it's from high blood pressure.... for example, preeclampsia during pregnancy causes high blood pressure/swelling.
hey, you know what, you may be right...i havent looked at it from that angle yet....hey...thanks

question: does anyone know if fluid retention, (swelling) is or has ever been due to high or low blood pressure?
title: does anyone know if...
